briefdescription.para: SCIP data structure

detaileddescription.para: creates the handler for xor constraints and includes it in SCIP

memberdef.argsstring: (SCIP *scip, SCIP_CONS **cons, const char *name, SCIP_Bool rhs, int nvars, SCIP_VAR **vars, SCIP_Bool initial, SCIP_Bool separate, SCIP_Bool enforce, SCIP_Bool check, SCIP_Bool propagate, SCIP_Bool local, SCIP_Bool modifiable, SCIP_Bool dynamic, SCIP_Bool removable, SCIP_Bool stickingatnode)
memberdef.name: SCIPcreateConsXor

briefdescription.para: SCIP data structure
pointer to hold the created constraint
name of constraint
right hand side of the constraint
number of operator variables in the constraint
array with operator variables of constraint
should the LP relaxation of constraint be in the initial LP? Usually set to TRUE. Set to FALSE for 'lazy constraints'.
should the constraint be separated during LP processing? Usually set to TRUE.
should the constraint be enforced during node processing? TRUE for model constraints, FALSE for additional, redundant constraints.
should the constraint be checked for feasibility? TRUE for model constraints, FALSE for additional, redundant constraints.
should the constraint be propagated during node processing? Usually set to TRUE.
is constraint only valid locally? Usually set to FALSE. Has to be set to TRUE, e.g., for branching constraints.
is constraint modifiable (subject to column generation)? Usually set to FALSE. In column generation applications, set to TRUE if pricing adds coefficients to this constraint.
is constraint subject to aging? Usually set to FALSE. Set to TRUE for own cuts which are separated as constraints.
should the relaxation be removed from the LP due to aging or cleanup? Usually set to FALSE. Set to TRUE for 'lazy constraints' and 'user cuts'.
should the constraint always be kept at the node where it was added, even if it may be moved to a more global node? Usually set to FALSE. Set to TRUE to for constraints that represent node data.

detaileddescription.para: creates and captures an xor constraint

simplesect.para: the constraint gets captured, hence at one point you have to release it using the method SCIPreleaseCons()

memberdef.argsstring: (SCIP *scip, SCIP_CONS **cons, const char *name, SCIP_Bool rhs, int nvars, SCIP_VAR **vars)
memberdef.name: SCIPcreateConsBasicXor

briefdescription.para: SCIP data structure
pointer to hold the created constraint
name of constraint
right hand side of the constraint
number of operator variables in the constraint
array with operator variables of constraint

detaileddescription.para: creates and captures an xor constraint in its most basic version, i. e., all constraint flags are set to their basic value as explained for the method SCIPcreateConsXor(); all flags can be set via SCIPsetConsFLAGNAME-methods in scip.h

simplesect.para: SCIPcreateConsXor() for information about the basic constraint flag configuration
the constraint gets captured, hence at one point you have to release it using the method SCIPreleaseCons()

briefdescription.para: SCIP data structure
constraint data

detaileddescription.para: gets number of variables in xor constraint

briefdescription.para: SCIP data structure
constraint data

detaileddescription.para: gets array of variables in xor constraint

briefdescription.para: SCIP data structure
constraint data

detaileddescription.para: gets the right hand side of the xor constraint

briefdescription.para: Constraint handler for "xor" constraints, $rhs = x_1 \oplus x_2 \oplus \dots \oplus x_n$.

detaileddescription.para:
Tobias Achterberg
Stefan Heinz
Michael Winkler This constraint handler deals with "xor" constraint. These are constraint of the form:

where $x_i$ is a binary variable for all $i$ and $rhs$ is bool. The variables $x$'s are called operators. This constraint is satisfied if $rhs$ is TRUE and an odd number of the operators are TRUE or if the $rhs$ is FALSE and a even number of operators are TRUE. Hence, if the sum of $rhs$ and operators is even.
